bboxes.raw_text:
A special feature of the US.
Army Field Bands concert, set
for $3.50 p.m.. Monday. April 9th
in Phoenix College Stadium,
Phoenix, will be the Soldiers
Chorus, one of the finest male
vocal groups.


The Soldiers Chorus is an
integral part of the u. S. Army
Field Band, combining the voices
of a group of its instrumental
lists and vocalists in the presen-
tation of their own special ar
rangements of well-known COM
positions.


St. Eugene w. Coughlin. De-
troit Lakes, Mimi, is chorus d.
rector He is a former SOLO
ist with operate and symphonic
organizations on the West Coast.


The chorus was formed when
the Field Band was organized in
1916 and has participated with
the band in concerts in all so
states, in Europe and in the Far
East.


The famed u. S. Army Field
Band will appear locally under
the direction of Major Robert L.
Bierly, its Commanding Officer.
The Bands local appearance has
been co-ordinated by the Phoenix
College Music Department in
conjunction with the chief of in
formation, Department of the
Army. The free concert is open
to the public.

A cats sense Of fun is one of
it's greatest charms. The simplest
things intrigue cats. They'll
stalk, pounce and tumble with a
plain wad of paper for hours. A
box to play hide-and-seek in or a
catnip trinket will delight them.


Be sure that your cats toys
cannot be splintered, torn apart
and swallowed. Give your cat
few toys to begin with and add
new ones from time to time. This
will keep him from becoming
bored and destructive.


The Purina Cat Care Center
suggests few of the toys which
your cat will enjoy:


celluloid ball that rattles.


cellophane and catnip bag.


"a spool attached to a strong


piece of string and hung from


a chair or doorknob.


"a rubber mouse that squeaks.


Be careful of open drawers,
trunks and closets. Cats love to
play in and investigate warm,
dark spots and are often unwit-
tingly imprisoned.


Also, if you tie ribbon around
your cats neck remember that it
can be dangerous as ribbons are
easily caught and pulled tight. If
your pet wears a collar outdoors
for identification purposes, be
sure it is large enough to slip
over the head if necessary.

by n. JACK MIDDLETON,
Purina Cat Care Center

"My Church Home will close
soon.


The list will benefit the build
ing fund of the church. For fur
Their information contact Mr..
Davis.

James L. Davis, leader of the
Texas and Senior Citizens Clubs


of First Institutional Baptist
Church, announces the patrons
list for the souvenir program

Sunday Union Baptist Church sponsored
Egg Saturday The home Of Mr. and Mrs Grady
Wady. 4543 E. Transmission Rd.


Chaperones Mesdames Eqla Jenkins Ruby
Coleman Wady Cora Lee Pipns Doris Coleman,
Maggie Scott Mahaa Thomas Charles Washington and Messrs
c. Elloirr and Hugo Griffin, supt.

On the average, one person
out of 10 in the US. walks to
work.

The average person spends
only rs minutes day in artic-
ulated speech: the rest of the
time spent "conversing'' he is
grimacing, Smiling, frowning,
Struggling, what have you.

TO APPEAR

to the public.

full articles.headline: Toys For Your Cat
full articles.article:
A cats sense Of fun is one of
it's greatest charms. The simplest
things intrigue cats. They'll
stalk, pounce and tumble with a
plain wad of paper for hours. A
box to play hide-and-seek in or a
catnip trinket will delight them.


Be sure that your cats toys
cannot be splintered, torn apart
and swallowed. Give your cat
few toys to begin with and add
new ones from time to time. This
will keep him from becoming
bored and destructive.


The Purina Cat Care Center
suggests few of the toys which
your cat will enjoy:


celluloid ball that rattles.


cellophane and catnip bag.


"a spool attached to a strong


piece of string and hung from


a chair or doorknob.


"a rubber mouse that squeaks.


Be careful of open drawers,
trunks and closets. Cats love to
play in and investigate warm,
dark spots and are often unwit-
tingly imprisoned.


Also, if you tie ribbon around
your cats neck remember that it
can be dangerous as ribbons are
easily caught and pulled tight. If
your pet wears a collar outdoors
for identification purposes, be
sure it is large enough to slip
over the head if necessary.

full articles.article:

out of 10 in the US. walks to
